Question.Text: An HIV-positive 35-Year-Old Malawian Woman with an ocular tumour in her left eye. It started as a whitish lesion on her conjunctiva several months ago. The lesion continued to grow and the affected eye eventually turned blind.

Answer: Ocular squamous cell carcinoma (conjunctival carcinoma) - The HIV-positive woman from Malawi presents with progressive ocular tumor starting as whitish conjunctival lesion leading to blindness. The images show large fungating mass involving conjunctiva and cornea with irregular vascularization. Conjunctival squamous cell carcinoma is strongly associated with HIV infection, HPV, and UV exposure in sub-Saharan Africa, presenting as aggressive locally invasive tumors.
